instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1398 820-3332-A that does not work on battery, and doesn't charge the battery, but works on charger. 
Besides the mac powers on, it has no green light...

Can you help?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Get the green/amber light first, without battery connected.
Check U6900/01 voltages.

Did you try another DCIN board?
What is the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi,

I'm testing with only the board on desk, and have already tried with other DCIN.

U6900:
1 = 3.4 V
4 =  3 V
5 =  3 V

U6901:
1 = 3.2 V
2 =  3.2 V
4 = 3.4 V
5 = 3.4 V

PPBUS_G3H  =12.25 V

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Looks like SMC issue.
U6900 works, but SMC doesn't control SYS_ONEWIRE.
Check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi,
Diode mode:
SCL = 0.563 V
SDA =  0.565 V

Voltage:
SCL = 3.4 V
SDA = 3.4 V

Shal i remove SMC?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: Be sure first to get power at pins 12 & 13 of U7000.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Yes, I have 3.4V on both.
Something strange happens: for 2 times, when I was measuring CHGR_RST_L, the fan stoped spining, and then turn on again after 2 sec(and keeps hapening from times to times)

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
That is same line as SMC_RESET_L.
Seems to be too weak signal in this case and it drops rapidly; is not normal.
Check for corrosion around U5010 and be sure R5000 is good.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: I can't see no corrosion on U5010, but the R5000 only has 65k ohm and should be 100k. Can it be it?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
High value resistors always measure lower value onboard, is normal.
The board restarts even when you don't touch SMC_RESET_L signal?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: No it doesn't

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: OK, then change SMC.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: I've replaced the SMC, but with the same result. It even reboots when touch SMC_RESET_L, and don't charge or work on battery.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Post all U5010 voltages.
Clean/remove J5100.
Replace U7000, if needed.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
U5010 :
1= 3.4V
3= 3.4V
4= 2.7V
5= 3.4V
6= 3.4V
7= 0.9V
8= 3.2V

J5100  cleaned and U7000 replaced. but still not charging battery.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Still no Magsafe light?
If yes, SYS_ONEWIRE trace may be broken, or need to change SMC again.
Once SMC is removed, check continuity for corresponding pad underneath.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
After all, it seams that i have magsafe light, but only with the original charger. On PSU, I don't have a light on magsafe, besides I have the light on other macs, with the same cable.

Shall I remove SMC even so?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H still low?
Be sure R7000 is good.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Yes it is. It's 12.24V
R7000 is ok (0.7 ohm, and is a new one).

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
If you get similar readings for voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines, then should be SMC, or ISL6259.
Remove D6950 (if present), just in case.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi, 
D6950 was (and still is) already out.

Diode mode:
SCL= 0.562V
SDA= 0.558V

Voltage:
SCL=3.4V
SDA=3.4V

As I have already replaced SMC,  I want to check  ISL6259 first, but can't find it in my schematics. Are you sure that is the one?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: What about U7000?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi,
I've repalced U7000, but same result. Shall i replace SMC again?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: Try known good battery first.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: With the known good battery is the same, and this battery on other mac, does work.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Then replace SMC.
Be sure to solder it properly.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi,
I've replaced the SMC, but everything is the same.
Any more ideas?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: Try another DCIN board.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: Same thing with new DCIN board

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
What is actual state of Magsafe light?
Try original charger and lab PSU with Magsafe 1 85W cable.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi,
The magsafe doesn't have light with the magsafe 1 (Original or PSU). However, with the original magsafe 2, it has a green light.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
There is a problem.
Battery cannot be charged, if no correct Magsafe light.
Post again U6900/01 voltages in this case (no light).

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: OK, I'll do so. But the battery isen't even recognized by the OSX. Does that mean anything?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Check R6950 and communication with battery connector.
Inspect the connector; measure on top of connector pins, instead of board pins.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
hi,
I have  continuity between R6950 and the battery connector. The connector seams ok, on top and on back. However, i don't get any voltage on R6950 (don't know it it is supposed to have some voltage there without the battery connected).

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Without light:

U6900:
1 = 3.4 V
4 =  3 V
5 =  3 V

U6901:
1 = 3.2 V
2 =  3.2 V
4 = 3.4 V
5 = 3.4 V ( it rebooted when measured on first time)

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
The DC voltages are correct, missing communication I supposed.
You can confirm with o-scope.
Be sure to have good continuity between U6900 and central pin on the Magsafe connector.

R6950 just ties SYS_DETECT_L to ground, in order to enable to battery.

An o-scope can also confirm activity on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: I have an o-scope, but not accustomed to use it :-( (yet). Shall I mesure it with the o-scope, directly on the SCL/SDA J6950 pins, to see if it has any activity?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
I have activity on SCL/SDA (attached img) but not sure if the correct activity (measured on  SCL/SDA J6950 pins)
I have  continuity between central pin of magsafe and the pin 5 of the U6900

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: Do you also note activity on pins 4 & 5 of U6900?

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message: Yes, i have activity on 4 and 5 of U6900. The wave not as sharp as before (much more messi/faster) but i do have activity)

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Then bad contacts between Magsafe and DCIN board.
Battery will not charge untill you get good communication between SMC and Magsafe 1-wire memory.

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
Hi,
But doesn't it should be recognized by the OSX? If not recognised, it will not charge I think. Even with the original charger, that gives a green light on magsafe, the battery isn't recognized by the OSX (with a known good battery).

threads.title: A1398 820-3332-A not charging
threads.message:
If battery is not recognized, is not enabled, or SMC cannnot communicate with it.
In this case, I can only suspect battery connector.
